text: The Bolivar Court Square Historic District in Bolivar, Tennessee is a historic district which was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. It then included 28 contributing buildings and a contributing object (a monument). It also includes 12 non-contributing buildings. With . It is at U.S. Route 64 and State Route 125 Architectural firm Willis, Sloan & Trigg contracted for the courthouse and Spires Boling is credited with the design. Architecture includes Classical Revival, Greek Revival, and Italianate. ==References== Category:Historic districts on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Greek Revival architecture in Tennessee Category:Italianate architecture in Tennessee Category:Neoclassical architecture in Tennessee Category:Hardeman County, Tennessee
title: Bolivar Court Square Historic District
